website_summaries.verdict: A lower-priced alternative to the 5D Mark IV that still offers plenty of features.
pros: A mid-size camera that offers excellent quality and works well as a beginner camera
Useful features, including WiFi connectivity, good ISO performance, and GPS
cons: No 4K video, which disappointed some users
The number of settings may be intimidating for beginners

customer_reviews.title: SO HAPPY!
customer_reviews.text: Some of the reviews had me questioning if I should upgrade... I'm so glad I ignored them!! If you love your 6D - you will DIE and go to HEAVEN over the 6D mark ii. Literally everything is better. The articulating screen is a game changer. How have I survived without it so far?! The low light capabilities are OUT OF THIS WORLD! I'm so so happy I upgraded to the 6d mark ii!! I would 100% recommend it! The more I use it, the more I love it. It has everything I loved about my 6D, plus more.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley BradshawTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: It's a great camera, and I really can't find many flaws ...
customer_reviews.text: Coming from a EOS Rebel T6s, this is my first full frame camera. I am beyond impressed with both the camera, and the quality of the photos it produces. I bought this with the included 24-105 L kit lens. But used mostly with my 70-200L 2.8 and 100-400L F4 for nature photography. It's a great camera, and I really can't find many flaws with it worth mentioning. I use it often for astrophotography with my Celestron NexStar 8SE. See included photo. The results are stunning. Best addition to the camera was the Canon extended battery grip for long shooting without having to worry about battery life. Overall, a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lakeshow75

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade, so happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I have loved my Canon 6D for years. I have tried other Canon bodies, but always seem to come back to the 6D. It's a perfect fit for my newborn/infant photography and I loved everything about it, except the auto focus! The 6D Mark ii has been amazing, it has everything I loved about my 6D but they finally fixed the auto focus issues! It still preforms great in all lighting, is lightweight. Full frame and a great camera! I love everything about it and I would buy it over and over. So glad I took the plunge to upgrade when it came out!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Harrah

customer_reviews.title: Try It You'll Like It!!!
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the reviews, watching the negative comments about this camera, I bought it anyway. Why you may ask.? I'm a canon shooter. Tried it and loved it. I own a portrait studio, shoot weddings, and do event photography. I use this camera exclusively since February 2018 and it has never let me down. What about no 4K video you ask? It's a simple explanation, I DON'T SHOOT VIDEO, I'M A STILL IMAGE PHOTOGRAPHER. Dispite what is being said this camera produces awesome pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Coston

customer_reviews.title: So happy with this upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to the Canon 6D Mark II from a Canon 80D. The main reason for this upgrade was for the better sensor and to be on a full frame format. I also purchased the Sigma 35mm 1.4 lense and it works beautifully with the 6D. If you want full frame but (like me) could not afford the 5D, this camera is just amazing for the price. If you spend that extra money on some quality lenses instead I promise you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Sheheartsprime

customer_reviews.title: Really nice camera
customer_reviews.text: I've been a Canon camera user for years. I love this latest pre-professional full frame. It has a lot of bells and whistles in a normal sized camera. Wi-Fi, professional settings, etc. The images I posted were all taken with this camera. They were edited in Affinity Photo software to enhance their color and details.
customer_reviews.author: Solsticeman

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Camera!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why I waited so long to pull the trigger on this one (probably weighed some of the negativity to heavily). I've been wanting a full frame camera for a while, and at this price couldn't pass it up. It's a great camera - easy to use, understandable guide book, easy set up. And the focus is lightning fast and accurate. With the battery grip it's a little bulky (will take some getting used too) and coupled with the canon 100-400 "L" lens the rig weighs a ton! My right arm is getting a workout - but I'm smiling the whole time I shoot.
customer_reviews.author: nitrofd

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera with the 11 - 22mm Canon lens (lens was $2,700) and camera didn't take as sharp of a picture as my Canon T3i with 10 - 24mm lens (that lens was $300). Swapped lens back and forth between the T3i and the 6D MII making sure the zoom and settings where as close as possible and the Camera just didn't take as sharp of a picture as the T3i. Decided to return the Camera and will purchase the 5D Mark IV.
customer_reviews.author: S. W.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome awesome camera.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to be a companion to my 6 year old 6d. Camera is awesome. What more can I say? Picture quality is great. Love the touch screen. Highly recommend this camera body!!!
customer_reviews.author: James P. Berton

customer_reviews.title: Move up to a full frame DSLR
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from EOS 60D crop sensor to full frame sensor. The features are very similar between the two cameras. Didn't need to learn too many new functions and settings. This camera is an entry level full frame camera for advanced amateur photographers. I'm still evaluating the picture qualities and starting to shoot RAW so I can edit the images in Photoshop or Canon's digital image processor software. So far I'm very pleased with my decision to upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Albert C

customer_reviews.title: New backup camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my backup camera (5dmii). Main body 5Dmiv. This is a 10/10 for the price point. I love it and it works well with my setup of lenses. Had a Canon 24-70 f/2.8 and 50 f/1.4 on it and had 0 issues. This would be a great first full frame for a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Bryant

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought this!!
customer_reviews.text: What a great mid-level camera! I couldn't decide between this camera or a mirrorless one. Ultimately, I went with the old tried and true Mark II and I have zero regrets. I'm a traveling photographer and needed something sturdy enough to take on long haul flights. This one doesn't have any fancy accessories but, to be honest, I like that - I can add what I need instead of paying extra for junk I'll never use.
customer_reviews.author: Chicago Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Big Improvement over the 6D
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the Canon 6D, but the 6D Mark II is much better. I especially like that Canon fixed the GPS issue. Now you can set GPS to shut off when the camera is off, but to automatically turn on the next time you switch the camera on, without having to navigate through a series of menus.
customer_reviews.author: John Brzezinski

customer_reviews.title: Canon EOS 6D Mark II Digital SLR Camera Body
customer_reviews.text: This is the lower end Full Sensor Camera for Canon and it is Amazing the Full Frame Sensor Draws Light In Like A Black Hole the photo above was shot at ISO 2000 with No Grain .... Now there is no such thing as Bad Light the 6D Mark II performs great .... if you are on a Budget and thinking of Upgrading to Full Frame this Camera is for you .
customer_reviews.author: LLoyd Stone

customer_reviews.title: Horribly soft images
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I got a bad one but the images are really soft. I've tried it with different lenses and also compared it with my 7D II with the same lenses and it's not even close. It's definitely a defective camera because there is no way this could be the case with every one of them. I've found online that this does happen to people but not to everyone. If I get it fixed I'll update the review.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: If you love the 80D or 7D and looking for a full frame, this is your camera
customer_reviews.text: 80D lovers are addicted to the touch screen and swivel function. Not to mention the wireless tethering In Bluetooth and WiFi. None of which come on the 5D3 and it’s suposedly a better camera. Then the 6D has the dual pixel autofocus which is boasted on the Canon EOS R but this camera is $1k cheaper. It’s a steal at its price point. Obviously, if you have more money to spend you might as well go A7RIII. Yes, it doesn’t come with dual SD card slots. But the things that drive me nuts about higher end cameras make this worth it IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Branden J. Turnbough

customer_reviews.title: Best Budget Full Frame Camera
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this camera for wedding photography and it works great with my sigma 35mm, if you're interested in switching to full frame without spending 2k, this is the best Canon Camera for it.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy/Edwin

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is superb. It's feature rich,but you don't need to use all the features. The swing out screen makes the features much easier to access than on the Digital Rebel series. The higher performance, including the much higher resolution and higher ISOs make the camera really sing. The ability to use much larger memory cards is also a big plus. The live shooting mode is a very versatile mode. It is bulkier and heavier, but it's worth it. If you have the money, this is a camera worth growing into.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L. Misch

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars for the camera body
customer_reviews.text: 5 Star review is for the camera body, not the lens. Camera is great, kit lens meh. But with better lenses, the camera is perfect for me, almost... too heavy (arthritic hands), but otherwise, amazing and easy to use. If I’d done a little more research, I’d have bought the camera body only, and purchased lenses separately. I’ve added lenses anyway, but would rather have applied the money toward a better lens. Hindsight is always 20/20.
customer_reviews.author: az quilter

customer_reviews.title: Amazing full frame sensor camera!
customer_reviews.text: This camera has been a huge step in all of my photography dreams. The low-light capabilities are incredible and I love all of the AF points. If you're coming up as an advanced amateur or pro-level photographer that has been using lower model canon cameras, the transition is easy and the quality is spectacular. If you don't know or intend to learn manual mode, It's an excessive use of your money, but if you intend to really use it to it's potential it is a steal of deal!
customer_reviews.author: Hope M

customer_reviews.title: Less noise than the 5D Mk2
customer_reviews.text: The olde 5D mark 2 was a great camera and i needed an upgrade. I won't be shooting thousands of photos, so i don't need the supposed durability of the higher-end units. Ansel didn't shoot thousands in a day, either. And it's not the camera that "makes" the photos, it's the human brain directly behind the camera.
customer_reviews.author: kkrome25

customer_reviews.title: I do like the articulated screen on the new camera
customer_reviews.text: Well I have own the first version of this camera , and while the cost is much higher , not sure that is warranted, but there are some upgrades . I do like the articulated screen on the new camera . And the focus points are very accurate and sharp . Other then that and more pixels this is the same camera .
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Makes it very easy to take low angle shots
customer_reviews.text: Canon finally produced a full frame camera with an articulating view screen. Makes it very easy to take low angle shots. Produces high quality images.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Staff

customer_reviews.title: Great cam with reach fetures.
customer_reviews.text: Changed to this one after 60D was stolen in Spain. I know that it`s not correct to compare that 2 models but .. huge advantage 6D. Rich functional including wifi, BT, GPS. Great matrix for handling night shuts. The only drawback is EF 24-105mm lens which is not allaw to embracing full potential of camera. Overall satisfied with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Askanaz Kyureghyan

customer_reviews.title: Freezes Constantly
customer_reviews.text: Save your money and order this from BestBuy. We bought this end of November.... first week to two was very pleased but out of no where it started freezing up while we took pictures. You cannot turn it off and have to pull the battery to get it to shut down. Requested a replacement but never heard from anyone. Called today and all they can do is refund me my money once the item is returned. Now we will be without a camera for a while. Not happy at all. Especially spending good money for an item and not being able to use it and have the funds tied up waiting on a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's an incredibly powerful camera that is worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely a good start on a professional level DSLR. The difference between an APS-C vs. full-frame sensor is staggering. I haven't had enough time to learn how to use all of the features, but the ones I have are a big improvement over those found in a beginner DLSR, such as the 600D and 1300D models I've used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Now iam taking professional pics. Great Camera, not so easy to use, but with all videos present in Youtube you can learn the best way to take some awesome pics. Loving it more an more at every click.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline H.

customer_reviews.title: Great in low light, fast, a dream
customer_reviews.text: This is was a long overdue step up from my 70D. This is a great camera, perfect in low light, and just took a small adjustment. Not a beginner DSLR, would recommend 70d or a nice Rebel from that series.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Variable Angle Touch Screen is Clutch
customer_reviews.text: Quality is unbeatable for the price range and the camera is a work horse. Two days after purchase I used it to cover a 2 day music festival and took over 9k photos. It functioned perfectly and the image quality was pristine. The variangle touch screen was incredibly useful in securing tack focus photos when shooting from odd angles.
customer_reviews.author: Magelen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera for the advanced amatuer photographer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera for the advanced amatuer photographer. Use it principally for single shots and not video. Wonderful feel to the camera. All the Canon lenses and one Tolina lens I owned fit this camera. Great quality to the pics I have taken.
customer_reviews.author: PKalus

customer_reviews.title: Great DSLR
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed with the picture quality, easy of use, easy of uploading from the camera using Bluetooth and convinience of the touch screen. Although it's not an entry level camera, anyone can use it in auto mode and get great results. For the advanced user it's even better.
customer_reviews.author: MyName

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera!
customer_reviews.text: Ah-mazing. Upgraded from a rebel t3i & it’s like going from a bicycle to a Ferrari. 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Gretta

customer_reviews.title: Manual focus a pain compared to MK1
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera. Gets the job done especially paired with quality glass. My only dislike is the manual focus confirmation was moved from the image in the viewfinder to the very bottom edge. Very difficult to see and don't even bother to pair with Zeiss glass anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: No Warranty
customer_reviews.text: Somehow I got sent a used camera, the screen went out 6 months later and the warranty doesn't seem to exist.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Amazing detail and very intuitive
customer_reviews.text: I was worried I would have a steep learning curve with transitioning from a T6 to the 6D Mii. Everything is fairly intuitive. I did have to google how to get rid of the level screen when leveling got mistakenly turned on, but it was simple to fix. The picture quality is amazing and I am seeing details like freckles that I didn’t see on my models before. Love this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Beth

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: Just switch from Nikon d7100 to the canon 6d Mark II for my first fullframe and I must say I love it, I was nervous to buy the camera at first due to all the negative reviews from popular youtubers but I figured since I only do photography I’ll go for it, I bought a 50mm 1.4 sigma lens to go with it and it works GREAT
customer_reviews.author: Lamont

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: Great Camera...haven’t quite figured out the WiFi option but overall pretty great!
customer_reviews.author: Aednat29

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my best camera yet, pictures are awesome!!! :-)
customer_reviews.author: jaro 72

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Disappoint
customer_reviews.text: First time using a full-frame. Started out my career with a Nikon D-40x and progressed to a Canon t5i, then to a Canon t7i. I was looking to shoot full frame for a while, so I did my research and pulled the trigger. Best decision I have made for my photography career.
customer_reviews.author: Seth wilda

customer_reviews.title: It's brand new and authentic
customer_reviews.text: The most cost-effective camera, with the explanation! Come and buy it. It's brand new and authentic
customer_reviews.author: sullivan@LA

customer_reviews.title: Great full frame starter camera .
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera ! Touch screen and wireless is fantastic ! Lot to learn but takes beautiful pictures in low light with proper settings. Pictures hold up good when cropped or zoomed in.
customer_reviews.author: lou

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera that won’t break the bank
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about it. I have had a 6d For years took it all over Europe for 1000’s of photos each year. Look forward to talking this one now.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Keen

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: this is my first time with a full frame, pretty awesome all the features that it includes and what you can do with it. just an FYI, you need to dowload a new version of Camera RAW, that you can find in canon.com because it will not work with the old version of Camera RAW for non full frame cameras to read your RAW documents.
customer_reviews.author: Mehrnoosh Montenegro

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade your 6D
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight is key for a photographer like myself who shoots daily. The display is a welcome upgrade. It’s perfect! So thrilled with how it’s upgraded from the 6d
customer_reviews.author: Kayleigh Stefanko

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, needing a class on it, but wow it's awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Kelvin/Rain

customer_reviews.title: The best for an amateur portrait photographer!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned this camera for less than a DAY and am head over heels for it. When deciding between the new Canon EOS 5D Mark III and an older 6D Mark II, I will consistently say that budget take priority. This camera is PHENOMENAL, image quality is great, and it’s well worth the investment and upgrade, without breaking the bank.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Cox

customer_reviews.title: What’s to say it’s Canon...
customer_reviews.text: More functional than the 7D, less expensive than the 5D. And as a full frame excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: Joel McDonald - CEO, Atlanta Picture Studios llc

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value!
customer_reviews.text: The 6d mk ii is fantastic, for the money I would say it's one of the best cameras to buy. It is also super light being a full frame camera so carrying it all day is much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: A great product!
customer_reviews.text: I was trying to buy the 5D Mark IV, but due to its price, I chose this camera instead. However, totally statisfied with the product. the only downside is that the Focus points in the viewfinder are compacted in the middle. Other than that. I'm okay with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Choi Jae Yong

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. It's lightweight and a good price. I wish it had dual card slots, but then I guess it would be a lot more money. I use it as a back up camera on weddings and to shoot real estate. It's good in low light and the colors are really nice on AWB mode.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen O

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this camera! Its definitely not a beginner camera unless you're willing to put in the work to learn your camera.
customer_reviews.author: Cayci Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Best camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. Started my photography career with the 6D and when I needed an upgrade, I knew I wanted to stick with the 6D Mark II. My favorite feature is the remote shooting capabilities with Bluetooth and WiFi. Lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine E.

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Second one I bought!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second 6d mark 2 I bought! I’m a wedding photographer and I absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Estes

customer_reviews.title: Sharp images
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this Camara beautiful photos but not for a beginner
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WHERE IS MY REFUND?!
customer_reviews.text: Some of the buttons didn’t work so I returned it and my refund is taking forever. 😬🙄
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Step it up Canon
customer_reviews.text: I like the camera but, it quit working after about 4 months. did not expect this from a Canon camera.
customer_reviews.author: David P Zeigler

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. But when taking continuous shots it will slow down and buffer for a bit and some times freezes in preview.
customer_reviews.author: vinmar119

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described.
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, use for astrophotography with 24-70mm lens and ordering a 14mm and 70-300mm soon.
customer_reviews.author: Scott C.

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for first full frame
customer_reviews.text: Love! Great upgrade for first full frame. Great quality all around, love the quiet shutter
customer_reviews.author: Bre

customer_reviews.title: Camera works as expected. Would have liked Lens bag.
customer_reviews.text: Surprised that a Canon L series lens did’t come with a lens bag. Maybe because part of a kit? Only L series lens I own that didn’t include one.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A great improvement over my 7D. Love the touch screen and photo quality.
customer_reviews.author: Techie One

customer_reviews.title: That it’s a great investment for intermediate photographers looking for something new
customer_reviews.text: I like how the Canon 6D Mark II is built solidly and takes great quality photos with the quick autofocus. I mainly used it for portraits with turned out great
customer_reviews.author: Shin Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Best buy ever
customer_reviews.text: Best buy ever! Love the clarity of each picture I take with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Rosa Nelly Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Its a great full frame camera.
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing i have found that i do not like on this camera. Its a great one..
customer_reviews.author: Howard B. Richter

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a 20D and this is a whole other universe of image quality.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Hiller

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Great in low light, helpful that the screen now articulated, and durable body. It’s a great entry professional camera
customer_reviews.author: Andy Cochrane

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: So far I’m loving this camera! I’ve had a Canon Rebel t3i for years and wanted to upgrade while still staying in my budget. So far the transition to a new camera has been great, and I feel like the images I’m getting are great for the money I spent!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS CAMERA SO MUCH.
customer_reviews.text: its so easy to use, it takes beautiful photos, and great in low light. here are some photos I shot with it.
customer_reviews.author: TiareVincent

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great product, and by far my favorite camera yet.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Best camera ever
customer_reviews.text: Best DLSR ever great mix of features Meet my needs when shooting professionally or doing amateur work
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Schulan

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade to Full frame from Crop Sensor
customer_reviews.text: Love this upgrade to full frame from a crop sensor on the 60D! Fast camera and great low light capabilities!
customer_reviews.author: P&K

customer_reviews.title: like it very much
customer_reviews.text: I have a 6D, I need additional for my life-long-expected Africa trip. This 6D Mark II came on time. The video auto focusing is what I was looking for. It works well, like it very much. I like the view finder, it makes me easy to do video. The battery is same as 6D, it made me much easy for travel. I felt that 6D Mark II has noticeable better picture quality and light balance. I have to use Auto for quick shoots for animal moves and under different lights. It seems that Mark II is doing better than 6D.
customer_reviews.author: B. Zhang

customer_reviews.title: speed
customer_reviews.text: this camera is tooooooo slow but good for those who are patient
customer_reviews.author: muhammad ibrahi m

customer_reviews.title: Cool piece of tech
customer_reviews.text: A good, cool camera for beginners. I enjoy playing around with it.
customer_reviews.author: Lin Zheyuan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to buy during holidays.
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Such an amazing upgrade from my t5 rebel. Major difference with resolution images.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful build quality, beautiful full frame picture quality, endless features...little pricey though, but you get what you pay for here
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: I liked...amazing.
customer_reviews.text: The design. My use is to photo e video record.
customer_reviews.author: joao roberto

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to operate with many cool features
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding performance during a wedding: very low noise under low light and the battery lasted all evening. Very easy to operate with many cool features.
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: And this meets pretty much all of my needs and beyond
customer_reviews.text: Very versatile, light, compact, and affordable. Compared to 7D which I had before, much improved ISO and picture quality. I am not a professional. And this meets pretty much all of my needs and beyond. Picture quality depends on the photographer's skills. This can produce beautiful images. No regret.
customer_reviews.author: Yoon Shin

customer_reviews.title: Better then I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: I needed another DLSR for taking photos for work. After comparing this model to a few others from Canon and Nikon alike, I choses this one as it seemed to be the best product for the price. I was sure not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: zlucke

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, great price
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. The perfect DSLR entry level, specially with the stellar portfolio of lens for this mount. Will be using this camera for the years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Martins

customer_reviews.title: Excellent reviews. Looking forward to using it for fall ...
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. Shipped fast. Excellent reviews. Looking forward to using it for fall Landscape photos. Touch screen makes it very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: DaveS

customer_reviews.title: I've only been using it for about a month but ...
customer_reviews.text: I've only been using it for about a month but so far it is an upgrade from my 60D that is very noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: A. Lopez-barton

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My first full-frame camera; after reading the reviews, it has met all my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Harry J Benson

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: A very nicely made camera, with great features. However, it is disappointing in low light situations.
customer_reviews.author: SKBedase

customer_reviews.title: I would like it if some of the focus points were further ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first full frame camera after using a T3i for a few years. I currently shoot portraits using the 50mm 1.8 and 85mm 1.8 lenses. I continue to be impressed with the features on this camera, particularly the ability to connect via wifi and offload photos right to my phone. I would like it if some of the focus points were further away from the center of the frame, although it hasn't been too big of a deal. It was hard to pick between this and the 5DmkIII but I'm glad I ended up with this instead.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great camera but note that Canon has changed the battery ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera but note that Canon has changed the battery again. This is a tiresome issue with Canon products. EGP
customer_reviews.author: EGP

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome camera. For me the dynamic range issues that some people mentioned were not a problem. It's only at ISO 100 that the dynamic range isn't on par with other cameras. This camera has greatly improved my photography. I have photos posted on my Instagram @willettra1n
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Willett

customer_reviews.title: Many featured Camera.
customer_reviews.text: Good build. Very solid. Menus are very complex and difficult to navigate. Lots of good features when you can figure out how to access them.
customer_reviews.author: gary h

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful " litter " camera.
customer_reviews.text: I Love it, love it, love it! Everything about this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Photographer

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what all the bad reviews are about. This is an excellent camera. I've printed several large photos and they look amazing. I love this camera and look forward to using it for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Product might not be new
customer_reviews.text: I bought a new camera but my camera came with a pink scratch right under the canon logo
customer_reviews.author: Akeem Jordine

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for video projects
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t want to spend a ton of money on a camera body. I think it’s important to find a good body, but great lenses make up for more than 60% or more in quality of video being produced. I wanted one that was full frame, shoots 24FPS and just really needed 1080P.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Voss

product_meta.title: Canon EOS 6D Mark II Digital SLR Camera Body – Wi-Fi Enabled
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Style:Body| Configuration:BaseCanon's EOS 6D Mark II features a high-resolution 26.2 megapixel full-frame Canon CMOS image sensor, Canon's DIGIC 7 image processor and a 45-point All Cross-Type Viewfinder AF system with enhanced low light sensitivity to EV -3 at the center AF point. Additional features include Dual Pixel CMOS AF and a 3.2-inch Vary-Angle Touchscreen LCD monitor, plus built-in Bluetooth and Wi-Fi connectivity as well as NFC for easy operation.
feature_bullets: Optical viewfinder with a 45 point all cross type AF system. Compatible Lenses: Canon EF lenses (excluding EF S and EF M lenses)
Dual Pixel CMOS AF with phase detection & Full HD 60p
DIGIC 7 Image Processor, ISO 100 40000. GPS, Wi Fi, NFC and Bluetooth low energy
Vary angle touch screen, 3.0 inch LCD
Standard Power Supply: Battery Pack LP E6N / LP E6
